message.content:
1. The patients in the study are aged between 10 and 17 years.
2. The patients have bipolar I disorder.
3. The patients are in a depressed episode.
4. The patients have a baseline children's depression rating scale-revised (CDRS-R) total score of 40 or more.
5. The patients have a Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) total score of 15 or less.
6. The patients have a YMRS-item 1 score of 2 or less.
7. The patients were randomized to receive either OFC or placebo.
8. The OFC dosage was 6/25–12/50 mg/day of olanzapine/fluoxetine.
9. There were 170 patients in the OFC group.
10. There were 85 patients in the placebo group.
11. The treatment period was up to 8 weeks.
12. The treatment was double-blind.

messages.content:
Statement: Patients aged 10–17 years with bipolar I disorder, depressed episode, baseline children's depression rating scale-revised (CDRS-R) total score ≥40, Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) total score ≤15, and YMRS-item 1 ≤ 2 were randomized to OFC (6/25–12/50 mg/day olanzapine/fluoxetine; n = 170) or placebo (n = 85) for up to 8 weeks of double-blind treatment.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
